list: For use with porcelain, ceramic, natural stone, mosaic tiles
Mix with MAPEI Grout Maximizer (#777136) instead of water for increased stain resistance and flexibility
For grout joint widths from 1/8-in to 5/8-in
For application in submerged conditions (swimming pools, spas, water features and fountains) once fully cured (after 21 days)
Don't forget your color matched MAPEI caulk
Using this MAPEI product may help contribute to LEED certification of projects

reviews.title: "Easy to mix and use"
reviews.text: I purchased Mapei products for my 1st tiling project and was extremely pleased with the ease of mixing and the final results. I have purchased only Mapei thin set & grout since then. This particular purchase was for my 5th tiling project. If a 60+ yr old woman, who had never laid a tile in her life before the first project, can use it with ease anyone should be able to get the results they want. I am including a picture of each of my projects. The first was a small entry floor, second was my kitchen and dining room floor, third was a fireplace hearth, fourth was the main bath tub surround and last was my bathroom floor.
reviews.author: DIYGranny

reviews.title: "Awful Product"
reviews.text: This grout is awful. We spent $1,000 on new tile for our floors and used this grout in black. We just had it professionally installed this week. The color isnt black at all. It is gray in some spots and white in other. Looks awful and now I am stuck! So upset and disappointed. Have waited years to redo floors and have everythjng all the same floor and finakly got it and now they are ruined by this grout. Can not afford to have them redone!
reviews.author: Katie

reviews.title: "Very Disappointed"
reviews.text: We purchased this grout first in Timberwolf.  Once installed it was so light it looked white.  So, we removed it and bought the Pearl Gray because it showed to be darker on the bag.  After it was installed, it appeared to be the same light color as the Timberwolf.  Rather than spend any more time and money (it cost us an additional $100 and several days of labor to scrape out the first color) we decided to get some Valspar Solid Stain in their gray color.  It took us about 5-6 hours to apply it in a 130 sq ft room but the color is much better.  The tile in these pictures is actually a light gray wood-look but they show the before and after and the difference in the grout. From now on we will buy our grout from a tile or brick store.
reviews.author: NanaFromAlabama

reviews.title: "GREAT PRODUCT!!!"
reviews.text: Great Product just wish it was cheaper! I tiled (grouted ) my shower and the floor with this product and it looks great and was EASY TO DO!!! I have been watching A LOT of DIY network and reading and watching how to videos on youtube and decided to do it myself and this was my 1st time tiling AND NOT BAD many comments so far many people have even asked to pay me to do their bathrooms as I explain I had ZERO experience before this and look forward to renovating more in the future tiling is now easy GREAT PRODUCT!!!
reviews.author: NCjsutton

reviews.title: "MAPEI 25-lb Sahara Beige Sanded Powder Grout"
reviews.text: MAPEI is supposed to be great grout,and why we purchased it.  But like I wish I saw before using this color it is not even close to the sample color.  We laid our wood plank tile as tight as allowed for a minimal grout line, and purchased Sahara Beige which the sample showed it blended perfectly so my floor would look like wood vs tile.  It came out light gray and now I have noticeable grout lines.  I was so happy about the look of the floors until the grout was dried.  Not sure how to fix it now.  We mixed in a sealer, so I'm not sure if applying a color on top will work.  MAPEI colorant has bad ratings, so I don't want to make it worse.
reviews.author: Vicki

reviews.title: "Terrible product DONT buy..."
reviews.text: I used this grout in Pecan color, it went on the correct color but dried at least 2 shades light and all patchy! some places it was light, other places it was dark. I used distilled water as suggested, mixed it exactly as directed and used distilled water for the cleanup too. I e  mail Mapei who were useless, said they had had no other problems so buy their grout refresh product!!  I  bought another company's grout colorant and used that instead. Will not buy or recommend Mapei products to anyone again.
reviews.author: Fcat

reviews.title: "Gorgeous"
reviews.text: I purchased this when i installed my flooring some months back when we bought our new home. it has remained white and gorgeous. I love my home and i love shopping at lowes for what i need to make my home beautiful. i was the one who installed my tile and grout so im very familiar with the product. just like any grout, clean up is a slight pain. Haze, haze, and more haze. But once its finally all off the floor it is stunning. Make sure to seal it and it will stay beautiful for a very long time. Do not be intimidated to have white grout in your home with pets or children, again as long as you seal it!!!
reviews.author: woodenmakeup

reviews.title: "Dries into inconsistent coloring"
reviews.text: Bought this color to go with Leonia porcelain tile in Sand. Dried into inconsistent colorations. whiter here, darker there. good thing that the tile has shades of cream and beige, else the grout would be really noticeable. Plus it's in our mudroom so if anyone privately wonders, they may think it's from  wetness from the outside. Used another bag of Mapei warm grey to go with grey marble-like porcelain tiles in our laundry room. that one dried into inconsistent coloration as well but good thing the tiles went under our washer/dryer. I'd avoid this brand and hope that their uncoupling mortar works out for the porcelain tiles we spent two days laying down.
reviews.author: Morris

reviews.title: "COLOR IS A TOTAL FAIL!!!"
reviews.text: I wish I had seen some of these reviews before I purchased this black grout. My backsplash is a mess! While this is a good product, it is a total fail with the color. I had no efflorescence, but I was very careful in the wash off phase. I added a photo of some of the extra grout that was left over, clearly showing the color fail was not efflorescence, and it goes clear through. I took a photo of their color card against the backsplash to make a comparison. I realize that it is written that the color is not exact but this is MAJORLY off! When I purchased black grout, I did not expect to get slate gray. I am beyond myself with grief over this! About the only thing to correct this is a grout stain or paint. I surely did not anticipate this added expense of both money and time. I hope that anyone that is looking for a black grout will look elsewhere.
reviews.author: MELANIE

reviews.title: "GRAY not charcoal"
reviews.text: The color of this grout dried GRAY. Its the wrong color. There are a smattering of spots that retained the charcoal color as well as the dried grout on the mixing paddle.Photos attached are used on honed slate tile that is black with blue undertones.
reviews.author: VDET

reviews.title: "Dries Much Lighter"
reviews.text: After reading reviews about Mapei grout drying lighter than the color indicated on the package, I decided to try Mapei Ivory sanded grout to go with my Mesa Beige tile. The color of the grout matched the color on the grout bag perfectly when it was wet. After it had dried it was much lighter. I wanted a darker color that is closer to dirt colored, and this is not it. It is a nice light color, but I know it is going to be difficult to keep looking clean. I highly recommend testing out different colors and letting them dry completely before choosing a final color.
reviews.author: DIYer867

reviews.title: "Easy Product use"
reviews.text: The Lowes employee was very helpful with this purchase. Although the grout appeared darker in the color chart, we are very pleased at the lighter color when applied. I think if one applies a sealer after it would be the darker color, but we added the grout boost sealer when we mixed the grout.
reviews.author: Ginny

reviews.title: "Good gray grout"
reviews.text: The Warm Gray sanded grout is very close in color to what is shown online and on the bag. We used almost the whole 25 pounds for our 44 square foot bathroom floor of 2x2 octagonal marble tile. The directions are clear and easy to follow. Mixing and applying five pound batches, I never had a problem with the grout setting or hardening before I was done grouting. Now that the grout has cured, it looks great, and it's holding the tiles firmly in place. If you're applying this to marble tile, seal the tile before you grout. Also, ensure you wipe the haze off the tiles two hours after you've cleaned it with the sponge. I waited a day, and the haze was very difficult to remove.
reviews.author: KenJ

reviews.title: "HORRIBLE!"
reviews.text: We used this product on our 500sqft kitchen when we replaced our floors. WHAT. A. NIGHTMARE!!! After we grouted the color was not even close to the charcoal color that it was suppose to be (as you can see by the pics attached). So I called the company and spoke w/Holdyn. After explaining that we purchased the recommended acid grout cleaner and scrubbed ALL the grout for 8 hours, he said it must me an extreme case of mineral deposits. So he sent use several bottles of grout refresh. This put us so behind schedule. We had to wait 3 days for shipping, and once it arrived it took me 14 hours to apply over EVERY SINGLE GROUT LINE. We will NEVER use this product again. Not only am I out the money for the 3 bags of grout, the liquid mix, and the cleaner, but who is going to pay me for all the extra labor that had to be endured to correct the product!?
reviews.author: Erica

reviews.title: "Inconsistent Color"
reviews.text: Tile was installed by an individual with years of experience and they have yet to run into this....  Grout looked great night one immediately after install but by days 2-3 once dry the color was very inconsistent and the darker gray color as advertised is now light gray in most areas.  From online research, common offenders are too much water in the mix or too much water at clean up, I am certain that neither was the case.  Mixed per exact instructions, consistency was spot on and clean up was done the right way, lightly damp sponge with no excess water and slow, just enough to make final clean up easier.  Very disappointing to be in this situation, solutions that I have seen are to "refresh" grout with another product but the thought of spending more money and laboring for hours on this after doing it the right way "according to manufacturer instruction" is far from ideal.
reviews.author: Luke

reviews.title: "Dries lighter than label"
reviews.text: I purchased the Biscuit colored grout as a test color for my new travertine backsplash. The product dries lighter than the color on the package. It dries a light beige/off white color. I have previously used Mapei grout and had the same experience with the Ivory. After researching forums to see if this was user error, I followed two tips that I discovered. 1) I used distilled water and 2) I stirred for the full time period indicated on the package. Despite these two tips, it still dried lighter. As for the grout itself, it is easy to work with, but finding the right color has been trial and error. I will likely be switching to another brand. If you choose this brand, I recommend testing out the color and allowing to dry completely on some extra tiles to prevent unsatisfactory results.
reviews.author: DIYer867

reviews.title: "Dries Grey"
reviews.text: No don't purchase this grout if you want a black grout.  I even purchased the grout maximizer and followed mixing instructions carefully.  The grout was black in the beginning but turned grey as soon as it dried.  I had originally bought fusion charcoal premixed grout and it looked great.  However, the fusion grout is expensive so I thought I would give this one a try.  I have attached pictures of both grout so you can compare.  Do Not Buy this product.
reviews.author: Terry

reviews.title: "BEWARE! Sample Color Was WAY Off!!"
reviews.text: So I saved tons of money by tiling myself (did a pretty good job if you ask me). It was a time consuming process though. Because of that, when I noticed the color of the grout was MUCH lighter than the bag had shown, I was NOT happy. The quality and the product is fine, but I was ticked when it dried and was more of an off white. I don't care how great the product is, if it's not the right color I won't like it. I know the color is technically "Ivory" but I was expecting the color on the bag... Guess I'll have to try and stain the grout...Oh, by the way, I feel like the water ratio was wrong. It was way to runny...
reviews.author: JJohn

reviews.title: "Dried WAY too light"
reviews.text: We decided to take on a project to lay tile on our first floor. Found the perfect grout color to match our tile (or so we thought). Mixed the Mocha Mapei sanded grout per instructions on the bag, and promptly laid grout. Needless to say, the next day we were EXTREMELY DISSATISFIED with the results. The grout dried SEVERAL shades too light, nothing compared to what we expected. Now we have to do twice the work to stain our grout the original color. We will use this grout to complete this project, for the sake of continuity- however, we will NEVER use this product again. Save yourself some time and knee/back pain, and try to find a better product. (Please see picture for dried grout results.)
reviews.author: Jordan

reviews.title: "Completed Renovated Master Bath/Show"
reviews.text: Awesome color choice for gray slate slabs
reviews.author: chicdecorators

reviews.title: "Dries Much Lighter"
reviews.text: After reading reviews about Mapei grout drying lighter than the color indicated on the package, I decided to try Mapei Ivory sanded grout to go with my Mesa Beige tile. The color of the grout matched the color on the grout bag perfectly when it was wet. After it had dried it was much lighter. reviews.author: Jordan

reviews.title: "Completed Renovated Master Bath/Show"
reviews.text: Awesome color choice for gray slate slabs
reviews.author: chicdecorators

reviews.title: "Color issue"
reviews.text: Like many other people have stated the color difference once dried is huge. It started as Navajo brown but dried a light rose color as best as I can describe. Disappointed as it throws off all the other colors in the bathroom. Probably will just revolve the grout with a paint tool.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: ""Black" is a relative term, apparently"
reviews.text: I used professional tile layers with more than 20 years' experience and who exclusively use Mapei on their projects. They tried to talk me out of black with my Serso Black Walnut wood look porcelain thinking it might be too dark. I stuck to my guns, and when it's wet...it is STUNNING. However, as soon as it dries, it is a medium charcoal color and NOT black. I came here hoping that my grout-reviewing community would be able to come to my rescue and recommend some sort of acid, refresh, sealer, etc. to fix this. I really want black grout. Anyone have a tried and true method? Did we get a bum bag? Very frustrating.
reviews.author: Shelley

reviews.title: "Wasted product"
reviews.text: Much better mixing measurements r needed in the instructions. I only needed to do a repair and had to guess at the amount of mix to water. I ended up making way more than I needed for my small repair job and therefore I consider this an unnecessary waste of product and money. If a person was doing a large job they would buy a large container of grout. If u have a small job typically you would buy a small bag of grout. The average person doesn't have a scale that can measure out a couple pounds of product. But even if we do we still have to guess at the amount of water to add to it. Adding some measuring instructions to the back of the bag would be good customer service.
reviews.author: Peach

reviews.title: "Mapei will not stand behind its products."
reviews.text: I have had major issues with this company. My client purchased Mapei grout and the color was off by more then 5 shades. This product was purchased from Lowes in New Orleans. Lowes is not responsible for this issue. Upon contacting the distributor, manufacturer etc etc. getting the run around from this company. the final resolve is, " We do not see this as a viable claim". Leaving my client with white grout when it should have been a dark tan. I do not recommend anyone buying this or any other product from Mapei. They do not stand behind their product, even when they mislabel the bags and or have an issue with the mix. This is the opinion of a tile setter with 32 years of experience. I did testing on other grouts from Mapei, the colors do not match what is on the bags. Buyer beware.
reviews.author: BastinEnterprisesLLC

reviews.title: "easy to use"
reviews.text: When mixing thinset and grout I have mainly used Mapei products. When using this for a shower floor it appeared to be a bit drier, but when I put it on the shower floor it was wetter than expected. Still it went on well. Flowed smoothly and got into the cracks of the pebble tile well. I did seal the stone before and will do again after everything is dry. Be careful when you clean it up with the rock it was easy to wipe out too much.
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "BEWARE: No sanded Caulk for this color"
reviews.text: Grout worked great and I have no complaints about the grout, however, Lowes does not sell a sanded caulk for this color. I assumed grey would be the most common color and did not even check to see if they had a grey sanded grout in grey. Mapei has a display in the flooring aisle of my store that says a caulk for every color of grout, however, what I did not realize is that Lowes may not sell the color. After grouting about 600 Square feet I find that the only way to get this color is to special order it directly from Mapei and I have to pay $14.98 per container (twice what the other colors cost at Lowe's) and wait up to 10 days.
reviews.author: JKinsman

reviews.title: "Love the color - a bit lighter than the sample"
reviews.text: Dries a bit lighter than the sample color. In full sunlight it is more of a light grey, in low lit areas it is darker and more like the sample. Very happy with the color. Used with white tiles and it gave just enough of a contrast without being too dark. Would purchase again!
reviews.author: MSUforever

reviews.title: "Inconsistent shades when dry"
reviews.text: We bought this color to go with grey marble-like porcelain tiles in our  laundry room. The grout dried into inconsistent shades, from almost white to medium grey. we mixed the grout well before applying. Good thing that 1) the tiles went under the washer/dryer in our laundry room and 2) the variations in grout coloring blended in with the grey marbling of the tiles. We also bought the Bone color of this same brand to grout our newly tiled mudroom. same issue with inconsistent coloration. We put a heater in that room  for three full days, at 75 degrees,  in the hopes that the grout would dry to one consistent color.  Not the case. Good thing the tile for mudroom also  had colors that helped to blend in the shade variations of grout. I'd stay away from this manufacturer.
reviews.author: Morris

reviews.title: "You must use distilled water for proper color"
reviews.text: If you want the color to be perfect you must use distilled water per the directions. If you don't the color will come out lighter than it shows. I discussed this with the sales clerk.
reviews.author: Kirk

reviews.title: "Not impressed with the final color match"
reviews.text: If only Lowe's had product reviews on the shelves before you buy this product I would have done things differently. After "installing" the grout in the bathroom project I was working on I read other reviews to see the same result as mine.Let's begin from the top. The instructions on the package could have been better. The instructions are drawings and at times I was not EXACTLY sure what they were saying. I had my Dad's experience and help so he knew what to do. I LOVED the color as I was spreading the grout across the 1/8" seam. It was a nice contrast against the light brown (tan) tile I was using. The next day I was excited to see how it dried and it was not the dark brown I saw the day before, nor was it matching the color on the package. It was basically the same color as the tile and I was not impressed. At this point I wanted to get the bathroom back together and I was not about to tear all the grout up to change the color. In addition to drying a much lighter color I see some color variations throughout. I mixed the grout according to the instructions (mix, rest, mix) and I mixed more than enough to cover the entire floor the first time.So, now I have to love the grout the way it is and chalk it up to charm. After reading other reviews it seems the best way to mix the grout would be to use distilled water. As to the lonjevity and the quality of the product, I know not, but I am sure it will be great.
reviews.author: CanadianBacon

reviews.title: "Wrong color, I do not recommend!"
reviews.text: I purchased Mapei Keracolor grout in Mocha several years ago when tiling my kitchen floor. After installation on half of the floor, I realized the grout was not the right color. It dries to a color that looks like it's been out in the sun for several years. I had to dig out all the dried grout, and I then used spectralock epoxy grout with much better results, although it is much harder to install due to fast drying times.Fast forward 3 years, and my husband is now tiling the bathroom floors. We decided to try a darker grout (charcoal) and went with Mapei Keracolor as Lowes no longer sells Spectralock. I was naive to think maybe it was just my inexperience with the first attempt grouting. Unfortunately, once again the tile dried to a terrible, sunfaded color. It's actually worse this time as some portions of the grout are dark (the color they should be) and other portions are almost white. The attached picture should help show the inconsistency of color. This faded color cannot be blamed on improper mixing with water as this grout was mixed at the same time, and it still has this color inconsistency, even within one 12" grout line.I wish Lowes would reconsider selling such an inferior product, or at least provide more options in their stock. I would really recommend for customers to purchase a different product than Mapei grout.
reviews.author: Casey

reviews.title: "DRIES WHITE"
reviews.text: We purchased this Pewter grout to go with grey tile and dries WHITE. NOT happy.  Based on the other reviews, it's clear there was a factory problem because this is not the pewter color sample I tested the tile with.  (See photo with samples of Mapei Pewter and Silver.)
reviews.author: L

reviews.title: "Inconsistent color variation!"
reviews.text: Used 2 bags of pewter to do a tile job. One is almost bright white, one is the grey pewter color, as shown on the bag. VERY unhappy.
reviews.author: LC74

reviews.title: "Let's clear it up. Don't make my mistake."
reviews.text: This product is great. Just pay attention. Follow the direction. If you think you might need more then one bag, mix two. Mixing all needed at one time will give consistant color across the floor. The manufacturer recommend that you wait seven days before you seal it because different areas, water amounts, and other things can effect it. It must be totaly dry all the way through. I started with Mocha, but it turned grey. Yes. It turned grey. This is because hard water can effect the grout (calcium etc in water). If you have hard water, use gallon jug bottled water. If you did used hard water, spray CLR with a hard nylon brush on the grout. Preferably before sealing it. This should solve the problem. If not, use sealer remover, wash floor, then CLR, and you can always use the stain that acts as a sealer. I just used CLR with a nylon brush, and the color came out great! If you realy want a beautiful floor, a little hard work and love is all it takes!
reviews.author: oume

reviews.title: "Awsome Product at a Great Price"
reviews.text: I installed about 600 sq feet of slate stacked stone on the front of my home, and this thin-set worked fabulously.
reviews.author: HomeHack

reviews.title: "Maipei Warm Grey Grout -- Uneven coloring"
reviews.text: The resulting grout color is inexplicably uneven, and in most areas the color washed out to white. The uneveness happened even though we carefully followed the water and mixing/timing instructions. The uneven color happened within a single batch. Not sure what I will do know. The Maipei thin set worked fine.
reviews.author: DavidGO

reviews.title: "Ruined New Kitchen"
reviews.text: Had new 10x20 porcelain tile laid in the kitchen with 1/8 grout joints by a tile crew. I selected Mapei sanded pearl gray as the grout color and it is absolutely NOTHING like the color sample. The pearl gray is almost more like a white grout with a hint of gray. It is lighter than fresh dried concrete. I was looking for a medium to dark gray as the color sample indicates. I paid to have the grout removed and selected a new color and this time NOT from Mapei. What a waste of money.
reviews.author: MBDFW

reviews.title: "Dries almost white!!!  Heed the reviews"
reviews.text: If you want ivory colored grout, this is the color for you.  I read that it dried too light and told my installer that.  He said that people who aren't professionals may not be mixing it right, yada, yada, and its not the grout that's the issue.  I had already tested the Polyblend grout from HD in the color Bone and it was perfect.  The grout sample that I had matched the color on the bag of Biscuit grout perfectly.  I told our installer who preferred Lowes brand that if he could assure me that it would be the same color, then I was fine with him using the Mapei.  He added the Mapei grout sealer to the grout instead of using water.  When the grout was wet, it was the perfect color.  I loved it!!  The next day it was WHITE!!  Fortunately I have white cabinets, so it doesn't look horrible, but its absolutely NOT the color that I wanted.  Now I'm trying to find a way to darken the grout which is going to add cost and time to redoing a huge area downstairs and two bathrooms upstairs.  BEWARE!!  Heed the reviews!
reviews.author: Georgiapeach

reviews.title: "Exactly what I want!"
reviews.text: I used this grout for both kitchen and outdoor. I liked the color so much, went back to Lowe's buy another 25 lbs bag for use on top of old grout. It worked perfectly match and with new tile floors. Now entire house looks new.
reviews.author: Artist

reviews.title: "Consistent Texture and Color"
reviews.text: I used this grout with a Lowe's 6” x24” tile with an 1/8“ spacer. The color and texture was consistent. Using along with the MAPEI Grout Maxmizer the grout was relatively easy to apply to both my floor and tub surround.
reviews.author: Joan

reviews.title: "Wrong color, I do not recommend!"
reviews.text: I purchased Mapei Keracolor grout in Mocha several years ago when tiling my kitchen floor. After installation on half of the floor, I realized the grout was not the right color. It dries to a color that looks like it's been out in the sun for several years. I had to dig out all the dried grout, and I then used spectralock epoxy grout with much better results, although it is much harder to install due to fast drying times.Fast forward 3 years, and my husband is now tiling the bathroom floors. We decided to try a darker grout (charcoal) and went with Mapei Keracolor as Lowes no longer sells Spectralock. I was naive to think maybe it was just my inexperience with the first attempt grouting. Unfortunately, once again the tile dried to a terrible, sunfaded color. It's actually worse this time as some portions of the grout are dark (the color they should be) and other portions are almost white. The attached picture should help show the inconsistency of color. This faded color cannot be blamed on improper mixing with water as this grout was mixed at the same time, and it still has this color inconsistency, even within one 12" grout line.I wish Lowes would reconsider selling such an inferior product, or at least provide more options in their stock. I would really recommend for customers to purchase a different product than Mapei grout.
reviews.author: Casey

reviews.title: "DRIES WHITE"
reviews.text: We purchased this Pewter grout to go with grey tile and dries WHITE. NOT happy.  Based on the other reviews, it's clear there was a factory problem because this is not the pewter color sample I tested the tile with.  (See photo with samples of Mapei Pewter and Silver.)
reviews.author: L

reviews.title: "Inconsistent color variation!"
reviews.text: Used 2 bags of pewter to do a tile job. One is almost bright white, one is the grey pewter color, as shown on the bag. VERY unhappy.
reviews.author: LC74

reviews.title: "Let's clear it up. Don't make my mistake."
reviews.text: This product is great. Just pay attention. Follow the direction. If you think you might need more then one bag, mix two. Mixing all needed at one time will give consistant color across the floor. The manufacturer recommend that you wait seven days before you seal it because different areas, water amounts, and other things can effect it. It must be totaly dry all the way through. I started with Mocha, but it turned grey. Yes. It turned grey. This is because hard water can effect the grout (calcium etc in water). If you have hard water, use gallon jug bottled water. If you did used hard water, spray CLR with a hard nylon brush on the grout. Preferably before sealing it. This should solve the problem. If not, use sealer remover, wash floor, then CLR, and you can always use the stain that acts as a sealer. I just used CLR with a nylon brush, and the color came out great! If you realy want a beautiful floor, a little hard work and love is all it takes!
reviews.author: oume

reviews.title: "Awsome Product at a Great Price"
reviews.text: I installed about 600 sq feet of slate stacked stone on the front of my home, and this thin-set worked fabulously.
reviews.author: HomeHack

reviews.title: "Maipei Warm Grey Grout -- Uneven coloring"
reviews.text: The resulting grout color is inexplicably uneven, and in most areas the color washed out to white. The uneveness happened even though we carefully followed the water and mixing/timing instructions. The uneven color happened within a single batch. Not sure what I will do know. The Maipei thin set worked fine.
reviews.author: DavidGO

reviews.title: "Ruined New Kitchen"
reviews.text: Had new 10x20 porcelain tile laid in the kitchen with 1/8 grout joints by a tile crew. I selected Mapei sanded pearl gray as the grout color and it is absolutely NOTHING like the color sample. The pearl gray is almost more like a white grout with a hint of gray. It is lighter than fresh dried concrete. I was looking for a medium to dark gray as the color sample indicates. I paid to have the grout removed and selected a new color and this time NOT from Mapei. What a waste of money.

reviews.author: Joan

reviews.title: "GRAY GROUT"
reviews.text: Goes on BLACK but dries to beautiful dark gray color. A bit messy being black in the application but finally cleaned up and dried nicely. Doesn't show dirt like light colored grouts.
reviews.author: kwWV

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: CJ

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: jose

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Revgary53

reviews.title: "this is a white grout, not brown or grey"
reviews.text: For the love of all that is good- do not buy this product! Lowes will not back this product when it comes out white and you have to take out all the grout between your beautifully laid tiles. They will not buy you a grout removing tool and the tile guy in the department will tell you "too bad". He'll tell you you should have tested out the product first- even though the only reason you should need to test the product first is so it doesn't mess up your tile, not to make sure the color is right.I am so upset. I had to pull out all this grout and now many of my tiles are chipped. I'm mad because this grout dried white, I'm mad because I did it right, I've tiled before, I was a supervisor for floor and wall so I know what I'm doing, I'm mad because Lowes isn't taking any responsibility for a product they sell. And I'm mad because I'm not the only person writing a review about the color of this product and the store Manager is still not going to call the company and make a complaint.After having purchased most of my new bathroom from Lowes, you would think they might care when their product messed up the largest feature in my bathroom. No, I'm just another dollar in their pocket.Go some place that will back their product. These folks did me wrong. Before I bought the grout, I asked a tile employee if the color was true to the package, he said "yes", but Lowes still won't back their product, or me. I can't believe I spent so much money and time in this store.
reviews.author: Lgal

reviews.title: "Mapei Sanded Grout"
reviews.text: Used several different colors in a recent re-model - Kitchen, 3 bathrooms and Utility. Floors, Wainscoat walls, shower and back splash. Excellent product, good color selection. Used with both 1/4" and 1/8" spacing between tiles. Attached photo is one example. I found you can also purchase caulk to match all the grout colors from the manufacturer. That's an added Bonus - but not available in my Lowes location.
reviews.author: G-Cube

reviews.title: "works well with 12x14 grey glass & slate wall tile"
reviews.text: We used this grout with the 12x14 mosaic sheets around the living room and family room fireplaces.Tile sheets (Lowe's item #354404/model#20-625) are multiple shades of grey glass and slate mixed together so color matching wasn't an issue.
reviews.author: HandyDawn

reviews.title: "very pleased"
reviews.text: I see a lot of reviews claiming that the grout is actually white. It is not white. I compared the color of the grout with what is on the package and it is very close. It may be a bit lighter, but not by much. It is most certainly not white or even off white. I used this with the Caribbean Slate and La Balantina brown tile and it looks fantastic. Note that Caribbean Slate is a bit of an off-white, almost beige tile and the grout is darker than the tile, offering a nice contrast. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because it may actually be slightly lighter than advertised (though it's pretty tough to tell unless you have grout lines an inch wide to do a proper side by side comparison) and because I have no idea how durable it is at this point. I'm including a picture of the grout with Caribbean Slate tile and my white fridge in the background so all 3 colors can be compared to each other.
reviews.author: IfOnlyLowesSoldBeerToo

reviews.title: "Too light"
reviews.text: The grout dried about 3 shades lighter than color showed on bag.
reviews.author: Nancy

reviews.text: The only negative about this product is that the sample color provided is much darker than the actual dried graut. I wanted a dark color and wound up with something much lighter, but it's too late to change now. I've applied the graut to the entire mud/laundry room.
reviews.author: Tammy

reviews.text: Goes on BLACK but dries to beautiful dark gray color. A bit messy being black in the application but finally cleaned up and dried nicely. Doesn't show dirt like light colored grouts.

reviews.title: "MAPEI NEEDS TO CORRECT THIS!!"
reviews.text: This is very ridiculous how this grout dries white to off-white, no matter what color you get! This mocha looked like the darkest brown, which I wanted. I used straight distilled water like Lowe's said...and it indeed dried the same off-white as the first batch, which was with city water. I will deal with it, as it is on my countertop....but will someone please tell me what brand to get that is true to color, as I will be very, very upset if the floor isn't the dark brown that I want. I've even bought the Grout Boost ($50 for 2 liters!!)...which I haven't used yet, but I don't want to mix it with Mapei grout, assuming it will fix this problem!! It has even changed the color of my tumbled marble on the countertop, with a haze that just won't go away. I'm told you can't put the haze remover on tumbled marble. So....all in all....I believe this grout should cost no more than sandbox sand, and should have no other color claim than white!!
reviews.author: Cyndi

reviews.title: "Dries very light!"
reviews.text: I should have read the reviews before purchasing! I'm really annoyed with this grout but it still matches my tile. It's way lighter than we wished for but it will do. I've included a picture with this review. I've included the color swatch I picked up in store and the grout is the actual drying color. Buyer beware.
reviews.author: Mrzcrwn87

reviews.title: "Sahara Beige Sanded powder Grout"
reviews.text: We did small plank tiles in a herringbone patterned and wanted this color to show off the lines. Sahara Beige is nothing like the color on the package. I didn't even think to review this product before I made the purchase. It turned out a very light silver and the floor is now nothing like we planned. It's like most things in life you learn by experience & the hard way. You would think that these people at this company would take responsibility over this issue since they've know this for a long time. I would not recommend buying anything from this company until they make a public apology and state they've fixed this issue.
reviews.author: Leo

reviews.title: "Color difference"
reviews.text: If you want a darker grout shade order the darkest one they have. The mocha color is no where near the color on the sample sheet that Mapei has. It is as light as the tile we put down. We were very disapointed in this.
reviews.author: PamM

reviews.title: "High quality product"
reviews.text: The power is very consistent and pure which is a must for grout. Makes a great looking tile grout and applys easily without any clumps or lumps in the mix. Nice lines and color is perfect.
reviews.author: Devon

reviews.title: "Colors can vary"
reviews.text: Used in a kitchen and it was much lighter after drying than the sample colors....it was mixed and applied in accordance with the directions.  Here is a picture of the other color I used with the sample. There is no easy fix for this...even the good ideas fairy can't help.
reviews.author: sgtmac168

reviews.title: "Perfect grout"
reviews.text: This sanded grout is what I chose to go with the rustic browns / tan brick backsplash for our newly remodeled kitchen .  Our contractor had no experience using this kind of grout on bricks, and was a little hesitant about trying it out, but he was very pleasantly surprised how easy it went on, and he had no problems at all.  I did read the information about it and purchased Distilled water so the color wouldn't change, and it is a perfect match with our backsplash.  We are very pleased with the look.
reviews.author: Amy

reviews.title: "color chart is off"
reviews.text: Was very disappointed when this grout was used. It was much lighter than what it looked on the color chart. I will never use grout again without first doing a test run, as it is too late after the fact. I lost sleep over this choice. I had used the other brand that Lowes carried before this in a bathroom and I loved it. The color was right on the money. This product that they now carry is NOT.
reviews.author: JJ

reviews.title: "Does what it should"
reviews.text: After reading several reviews about color inconsistency, I made sure to use distilled water for mixing rather than my tap water since I have a well and my water is extremely hard. In doing that, I haven't seen an issue with any color variations. It's been a few weeks since I finished it. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars may be more of a user issue vs. a product issue. My only problem with the product was that it seemed to dry out faster than I could use it. But again, maybe I should have just mixed a smaller amount to start with. Overall, I found the product pretty easy to work with and the results are nice!
reviews.author: Notnormal

reviews.title: "grey is a tricky color"
reviews.text: I too was going for a gunmetal grey grout color for the entry tile (porcelain slate-looking tile)Thought it dried lighter than the swatch color on the bag, it's dark enough to accomplish the look I was going for.
reviews.author: HandyDawn

reviews.title: "High Quality Product"
reviews.text: Been using pre-mixed grout and powdered grout for numerous recent projects.  While the pre-mixed is convenient, the powdered grout allows me to mix just what I need without waste.
reviews.author: TileGal

reviews.title: "Great product."
reviews.text: I was looking for a darker color but in the end the mocha was a perfect match for the tile I was installing. Blended well.
reviews.author: Larry

reviews.title: "Dried a lot lighter than expected"
reviews.text: Wanted a colored grout ended up white   Not at all what I expected. Very disappointed with the way my expensive tile looks now
reviews.author: Damson

reviews.title: "Consistent Quality"
reviews.text: Bought several bags of this product.  It exhibited consistent composition and quality.  Easy to mix, use, and clean-up.
reviews.author: TileGal

reviews.title: "For the Pro and Novice"
reviews.text: Butters- up real smooth, spreads effortlessly, wait recommended time and wipe clean with damp sponge! That's it , piece of cake . Make sure to use clean water. I use three rinse buckets at a time. works great! Take your time, use small plastic or metal putty knife to remove grout from corners for a more professional look . Good Luck, and remember have fun and take pride in your work!
reviews.author: Skeeter

reviews.title: "The New White!"
reviews.text: Beautiful, Unique and Eloquent Pearl Gray Sanded Powder Grout. It made my bathroom my own.
reviews.author: Tavion

reviews.title: "Little advice for first timers"
reviews.text: I loved the color and how it looks with our tile. The best advice we got came from our contractor. He told us that the end grout color will be 95% the color of the grout in powder form. So, if you are considering colors, you may need to buy a bag and then check the dried powder color of the grout against the tile. In our case, this way of matching and picking colors gave us the best result. In the picture you can see how the color contrasts with the ungrouted area.
reviews.author: LE

reviews.title: "Great Product"
reviews.text: Worked great for my tile flooring
reviews.author: KyleSin

reviews.text: Dried pretty true to color.
reviews.author: H

reviews.title: "tiled entery way"
reviews.text: Mixed well and was easy to spread and clean up. Also good on toast. Jk

reviews.author: chris

reviews.title: "Very disappointed"
reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. We've done tile before, so we have a good idea of what we're doing.Followed the instructions exactly (amount of grout, amount of water#, and the product was basically unusable -- way too dry to be able to apply properly. It was like crumbly sand on a beach. There was no way to adequately work it in to our grout lines, or to use the float to properly wipe it away. It just made a big mess. I ended up having to add more water to make it into a workable consistency.But, once done, this grout exhibited really horrible efflorescence #the white powdery look in the grout). We've tried lots of solutions, but so far are still struggling with fixing the problem. If you look on the mfr's website, it'll say something to the effect of "you got the grout too wet, and that's drawing the salts out of the cement." In other words, it's not their fault, if you used too much water.Of course, as I noted above, the product was unusable when following their recommended amounts of water -- so there appears to be no way to have a successful outcome.We've never had such issues with other brands of grout, on multiple projects. I would definitely recommend against using this product.
reviews.author: fixer-upper-adventures

reviews.title: "Biscuit grout"
reviews.text: Biscuit looks great on the bag , looks white on the tiles when dries.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Color differs greatly from sample"
reviews.text: While this grout applied as it should, it dried several shades lighter than the in-store sample and the color on the bag. It will require us to stain the grout to a darker color when it has adequately cured. Disappointing and a lot of additional work.
reviews.author: Hobo

reviews.title: "Great Product!"
reviews.text: Product is super easy to use and LOOKS FANTASTIC with Grey tile. Key here is to wipe with clean water and sponge every time! All-in-all very happy and would definitely recommend.
reviews.author: lookingtosell

reviews.title: "Color Blind?"
reviews.text: Doesn't look like the color on the bag when dry. Dries about 2 shades lighter...beware!
reviews.author: evishome

reviews.title: "Color not true the label of the product."
reviews.text: The color of biscuit grout dries very light almost white.
reviews.author: HJWIR

reviews.title: "Grout dried uneven Almost White in certain spots"
reviews.text: I mixed grout to the exact specifications on bag. The finished result was very blotchy uneven grout lines dry Almost White in many areas. I was using the sanded warm gray color. This was no fault of my own I followed the manufactured instructions on how to mix and apply grout. This issue has to be a result of the manufacturing of this product. Mapei needs to correct this problem before it causes more people headaches and money lost. I recommend people stop using this product until the manufacturer correct the issue.
reviews.author: Brad

reviews.text: Great grout, if I were to change anything it would be to make a smaller size bag. It was way more then we needed.
reviews.author: shiningstar3511

reviews.title: "Navajo brown... Apparently not brown at all"
reviews.text: Navajo brown is not brown at all. It is more of an ivory. Very disappointing.
reviews.author: Tbird7178

reviews.title: "Very  good  product"
reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Robase

reviews.title: "good stuff"
reviews.text: mixed well...spread clean....no complaints....I buy this same stuff every job I get and never had one issue ever......
reviews.author: BigChuy

reviews.title: "Black grout is light grey"
reviews.text: When wet the grout is the ideal color, jet black. As soon as it dries it is light gray in spots or even white. I assumed this is a haze issue so after grouting the entire floor, failing to remove haze, removing grout and redoing, I am still dealing with the same issue. Seeing now that others are having issues getting an accurate color.
reviews.author: Dchash

reviews.title: "White Sanded Grout"
reviews.text: Good color to make tile stand out. If mixed correctly, it's easy to apply & work with. Dry time starts in about 20-30 mins & you can start to clean the tile with a damp cloth. As with any light/white grout, high traffic areas will get dirty over time. Seal the grout after its dry & when it gets dirty, acid wash it & reseal.
reviews.author: Tyler

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: This was my first try at laying a ceremic floor and I was looking for a product the would be able to withstand water yet easy to use. The directions on the bag were execellent and is was very easy to work with and to apply. Looks great also.

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Sandra

reviews.title: "Cocoa dried to light tan/brown"
reviews.text: Would never buy again. Used over 70 pounds for newly installed all tile bathroom.  Once dried the color cocoa lightened up to a veryyyyy light brown.  Totally DESTROYED the look of a $30,000 dollar beautiful bathroom. If you're looking for a cocoa grout DO NOT USE. This is a poorly made product with false advertised color! Totally upset while writing this review. Trust me, if you've ever been through it, you know that sick feeling and there's not a darn thing you can do about it with these big companys......

reviews.title: "Smoke color is a Lowe's exclusive"
reviews.text: I purchased this grout as a recommended accompaniment to some tile also purchased at Lowe's.  When the job was complete and it was time to caulk around the tub and fixtures, I found the complementary Mapei smoke color was not available in the Mapei Keracolor caulk line...you can select frost color which is lighter in color or warm grey which is darker but cannot get a matching color.

reviews.title: "Patio reveal"

reviews.author: Janice

reviews.title: "Worked well"
reviews.text: Kitchen backsplash has been up for 2 weeks so far. The grout work and tiling went well. Found it interesting how little water is needed for this product. My plan was to mix small batches, but the amount of water I first put in the bucket turned out to be the amount I needed for the entire package. I can't tell you how much water I started with, but I thought it to be a small amount. Everything turned out great. My advice is to start with a really small amount of water. You can always add more.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Grout"
reviews.text: Wanted frost grout but they were out so went with warm grey probably a little darker than we wanted but it turned out great. Great product and great price. Never done tile before and so can't really compare to other brands but it seem to work great to me.
reviews.author: Bosoxs82

reviews.title: "Wish I wouldn't have used this product."
reviews.text: I was talked into using this grout on my Moms backsplash.     I mixed this stuff according to the directions and noticed it seemed to be slightly foamy as if I mixed it too much but I did exactly what the instructions said.     Then I waited a couple minutes per instructions and mixed again.     I then started using it and noticed air bubbles in several places that I had to go back over.    Because of the air bubbles this project took much longer than I anticipated.     Also, the color of the grout dried much lighter than what was indicated on the bag.    About a week after I tiled Moms backsplash my Mom called and said the grout sunk in several areas.     I wonder if this is because of the air bubbles.     Should have just used the same grout I had used before.
reviews.author: Lulu

reviews.title: "Color"
reviews.text:
I'm pretty disappointed in myself for not reading the reviews on this before making the purchase and grouting my tile floor. I figured I didn't need to read the reviews because I knew it was a good brand and figured if they are going to show what the color is on the bag it has to be that color once it dries. Similar to paint if you pick a color you expect to get that color but that was not the case.

After I grouted it looked great and was the color I had expected but after several hours of drying it turned into a grayish color totally changing the look of the floor and leaving me with a much different color then I had planned. In order to truly test this product before grouting you would need to mix a batch and set it thin so it dries as it would in-between the tiles to find out its true color.

reviews.text: Tiled my front patio - Used Mapei thinset, and got the #9 grey grout (and matching caulk) - This was my first time tiling/grouting - It went surprisingly well!  So far everything looks great!  Worked like expected - easy to mix (using a drill) and filled the 1/4inch grout lines easily with a rubber grout applicator.....I don't really have anything to compare it too - but I can say it was pretty freaking easy to use!

reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Do not use - dries VERY light"
reviews.text: This grout is garbage.  Do not use unless you want a very light brown color.  The ONLY time this grout looked like it was supposed to was when it was wet.  I have done multiple tile installations so this isn't my first puppet show. I followed the directions to the letter.....I stirred up the powder before mixing with water, I used distilled water, measured it precisely and mixed it all up with a low speed drill with mixing paddle. I worked in small batches and did not add any additional water to the mix. I let it dry to the point of firmness and then wiped it down once with a very lightly/barely damp sponge to smooth the grout line and then immediately dried the grout lines with a cloth so there was NO water on the grout. My reward.....grout that looks like coffee with too much milk in it and nothing at all like it is supposed to. A HUGE frustrating disappointment. Thanks so much Mapei.
reviews.author: sandytoesFL

reviews.title: "Ggood stuff"
reviews.text: Easy to work with. Easy match over numerous bags. Gives just enough time to work with.
reviews.author: Shaggy

reviews.title: "Great product but..."
reviews.text: I recently replaced two broken tiles in my foyer area and used the Color sample card to pick the best color match for the in place grout. After mixing and applying the grout, letting it set and cure, I was a little dissappointed at the outcome of the color. The color key on the card was spot on with my pre-existing grout and when it was said and done, the grout color came out two shades lighter. I am now having to purchase a grout pen with a darker color in order to match the previous grout color. If I cannot find a color that will work, I am going to have to purchase another bag of a color that is darker then what matches on the card. My recommendation is to either regrout the whole area with the same colr new grout or purchase a shade or two daker than what you want. Other than the color issue, this product was easy to use and is great for first time grouters like myself. I am sure that professionals are more skilled at matching the colors then I am, but purchasing a product for DiY, they need to make the colors on the packages match the outcome colors.

reviews.title: "good"

reviews.title: "DARK Colors dry WHITE; Worst hazing of any grout"
reviews.text: Hubby and I have been cleaning repeatedly taking turns trying to clean the haze from the tile but this is undeniably the WORST grout I have EVER used for leaving a haze. And the color does NOT dry true to color. The straw color I put on the walls dried WHITE. Even the mocha color I put on the floor is almost WHITE. I am so disgusted I have vowed to never again use MAPEI grout.

We also purchased the smallest bag available at the store. This time the waste was about 80%.

reviews.title: "Did not wash up well"
reviews.text: As my installer was washing the grout, they continually commented on how light the color was compared to the picture on the bag. The grout color is VERY light (we wanted dark), and hopefully after repeated washings and use the color will resemble what I was looking for. Not happy thus far, though it may relate to the installation and the need for more washing...

reviews.title: "Sanded Powder Tile Grout"
reviews.text: Went to the store to get some gray grout. Found out there are many colors of gray, which is sad that there is no single standard color gray. I was close to what I was looking for but lighter than what I had to match to. Very easy to use. Only drawback is you have to buy 10 pounds, when all I needed was about a cup. Oh well.

reviews.text: I bought this grout because I was told by the Lowe's associate that it was the "best grout" available. I chose the dark pewter gray, because I wanted dark gray! Some of the grout lines are almost bright while, while others are a medium gray. Overall, I am not happy with this product's result. If I wanted white grout, I would've purchased white grout.

reviews.text: Everything went greatI mixed the entire bag with the exact amount of water it called for exactly the way it specified (Mix, let stand, Mix). The color before curing was great. I was super excited and actually hoped that it would dry maybe a shade darker but when I checked on it the next morning it was completely white. What a disappointment.

reviews.author: John

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: cp

reviews.title: "Color does not match sample picture."
reviews.text: I'm no stranger to tile work, I learned from, and worked with a pro who had been in the business for 30 years so I have a good knowledge of what I'm doing.I used both the sanded and unsanded Mocha grout in my kitchen, sanded on the floor and unsanded on the backsplash. As most others here have said, the final color of this grout when dried isn't even close to what the sample on the bag shows and it doesn't come out a uniform color, it's darker in some areas and lighter in others. I followed the instructions to the letter, I used distilled water and I made sure not to get it overly wet when sponging it off. It still came out considerably lighter than the sample color.When I did the backsplash (the unsanded grout) I did each side separately. I mixed the first side using the maximum water, which turned out a little thin so I mixed the other side using the minimum amount, even that made no difference. To make sure I didn't over wet the grout I wrung out the sponge as much as I possibly could and only worked the grout enough to remove the excess and give it a slightly concave surface. (This left a lot of grout residue on the tile which took considerable effort to get off after drying.) The next day it was the same as the floor, no difference at all.The final insult came when I used the so called matching caulk. At first the color was quite a bit lighter than the sample on the tube, not as light as the grout but the contrast wasn't so bad and I figured I could live with it. However unlike the grout, it dried considerably darker, darker than the sample picture even. The contrast between it and the grout is way to much. There was also a lot of shinkage, when I applied the caulk I worked it until the couture was even with the grout, but when it dried it sucked back into the gap so much it will need a second coat. This actually worked to my advantage because at least I don't need to remove it to apply a color that matches.
reviews.author: Kevin

reviews.title: "Chamois Sanded Grout"
reviews.text: Removed old grout wanting a color change in a 120 sq ft walkin bath closet area. Re grouted closet area using a water mixture and the bathroom area using MAPEI Grout Maximizer. The results were the same in appearance a blotchy color with some effloresence. I am not a professional, but have grouted many tiles with great results. I am aware that excess water both in mixing and cleanup can destroy the appearance of grout. I am hoping after full cure of 21 days that Sulfamic Acid Cleaner will even out the color of the grout.
reviews.author: Willy

reviews.title: "Good Product"
reviews.text: When mixed correctly, this is a great product. True to the color on the bag. I had no problems with this grout at all!
reviews.author: Low

reviews.title: "Looks good wet dries very light"
reviews.text: I bought this grout because I didn't want a light color that would show stains. Well this "MOCHA" dries as light buff. It looked great going on but the next day it was if someone had come in and swiched our grout color. Don't know if I got a bad batch or what but we had a very experienced tile layer install so I know that mixing was not the problem!

reviews.title: "Set up too fast"
reviews.text: I bought a #25 bag of black sanded grout for a 10 x 10 room. I mixed it per instructions. I thought it was a little stiff as I was mixing it, but I had put in the 2 qts. of water as directed. When I had finished mixing and re-mixing, again per directions, the grout was so stiff I could hardly spread it. I checked and found that it was not recommended to add more water. Before I could finish the floor (about 1 1/2 hour) the grout was so hard that I couldn't scrape it out of the bucket. When I went back to Lowe's and asked the flooring guy, he said that it shouldn't have set up that fast, 3-4 hours working time, He did cut me some slack and give me another #25 bag at the #10 bag price (they don't stock #10 bags in black), but since I only needed about #10 to finish....To finish a long story, if you are using this and it looks too stiff add more water. I only mixed a partial bag the second time and didn't try to calculate the water needed, I just added water until it looked right, about milkshake thick. The second attempt went well and looks great. This was the only problem that I had.
reviews.author: SteveM

reviews.title: "garbage"
reviews.text: tec was and still will be a better product.  Drys within minutes after mixing.  Tec i was able tonworkmworh for an hour.  Now my tiles is a disatwr because of this product.  The contractors were in store and said how much this product has cost time and money.  Yes tec increased pricing and was removed off shelves and this garbage was put out.  Never will purchase again even after mixing the product correctly

reviews.title: "Easy to mix"
reviews.text: I didn't need the entire package mixed at once, so figuring out the water to mix ratio involved more math than I was willing to do at the time. Mixed it until I had the correct consistency and appears to be working great. Had to spray some water on the tile while applying due to it drying out quickly while floating, but likely due to me mixing dry. Proud of how the tile turned out and the price is very reasonable.

This was my first tiling project and the uneven color of the grout was really where the project fell apart. I need to figure out if I'm going to regrout half the job or recolor the grout. Not a pleasant proposition either way. I blame myself for not researching this product better -- I should have chosen an easier to use product.

reviews.text: This grout dried much lighter than the swatch.  It's almost light beige.  The wet color is accurate and matches the swatch so it looks great while applying.  Then you get a shock when it dries quite a bit lighter.  Very disappointing to put so much time into a job and have it ruined like this.  I've used the Permacolor grout and caulk from Home Depot and they match exactly.  I expected the same from this.

reviews.text: We waited and saved to do our floors. We picked Bahama beige and it dried white and two toned. We had the contractor remove it and replaced with new grout thinking it was listed wrong. I would no get this product and am upset that lowes said the variation in color, brown to white , was acceptable.It also dries in different shades and doesn't match the bag the color says it is. That is not acceptable.

reviews.title: "Great Color But No Matching Caulk"
reviews.text: We bought this grout for a bathroom remodel. It was the color suggested to match the tile we also purchased at Lowe's. While it's a nice color, we didn't realize until later that MAPEI no longer makes a matching caulk. We contacted MAPEI for the closest color match and was told it is now Alabaster. Good to know if you're using this in a bathroom and need caulking for along the bottom of a shower/tub.
reviews.author: Robs727

reviews.title: "CHANGES colors"
reviews.text: I thought this would be a great product but dried completely WHITE. It looked awful. I had to chip it all the way out. So disappointed. What a waste of money.
reviews.author: disapointed

reviews.title: "POWDER VS PREMIX"
reviews.text: After purchasing the premixed grout for previous tiling projects, I was reluctant to try this powder version. The sales associate reassured me and did a quick overview of the mixing instructions. I also bought an beater that inserted into my electric drill to insure the consistency while mixing and was set to go. After applying the grout, it dried to the exact color as shown on package.
reviews.author: DYIGirl

reviews.title: "Disaster"
reviews.text: Used this grout in a huge area and was beyond disappointed. The color is inconsistent and looks terrible. Now the budget and timeline is busted because we have to try to fix it and I'm afraid I will never be happy with my brand new floor all because of this product.
reviews.author: Stacey

reviews.title: "MAPEI KerCkr S Mocha Sanded Grout"
reviews.text: To maintain color continuity through all tiling throughout the home, I chose MAPEI grout for floor, bath tub surround and fireplace.  I found this product installed easily and cleaned up easily making the my job easier.  The results turned out great and accomplished the goals I set for the project.  The proof was in the pudding with my customer enjoying the results as well.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Excellent shower grout"
reviews.text: I needed a white grout (not bright white) to repair some areas in my tile shower.  Following the directions on the package, and using only water, I achieved a superior result--the grout set up rock hard and looks professional.  I used this sanded grout where non-sanded grout was previously used--with no problems.  After this excellent result, I will always use sanded grout.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "Really not good"
reviews.text: Just remodeled 2 bathrooms and bought 4 different colors of MAPEI grout.  If you absolutely have to buy this, then be sure to mix up the WHOLE bag, mix it VERY VERY well, and re-mix it FREQUENTLY.  Pigment is extremely inconsistent and it looks like I used about 12 different colors of grout in each room.  Almost $20K worth of remodeling and the end result is disappointing.
reviews.author: witchblade

reviews.title: "Grouting made easy"
reviews.text: First tile job and as with most people I was worried about grouting. This had good reviews so I went with it. I followed the instructions to the letter. It was not as thick as most of the YouTube how to videos said it should be. Even though it was runny I went with it. Worked it into the seams and waited 15 minutes to wipe it off as instructed and it turned out beautiful.
reviews.author: Dreamweaver

reviews.title: "Uneven color through out the floor"
reviews.text: So disappointed, we normally go with Home Depot but they didn't have the color we wanted, it is so uneven. We will not be using Lowe's grout for our kitchen floor

Charcoal is supposed to be dark grey, nearly black. We are now buying grout refresh and going through the tedious task of painting over the grout to make it coordinate with our tile - super bummed out.

Pigment is extremely inconsistent and it looks like I used about 12 different colors of grout in each room.  Almost $20K worth of remodeling and the end result is disappointing.
reviews.author: witchblade

reviews.title: "Grouting made easy"
reviews.text: First tile job and as with most people I was worried about grouting. This had good reviews so I went with it. I followed the instructions to the letter. It was not as thick as most of the YouTube how to videos said it should be. Even though it was runny I went with it. Worked it into the seams and waited 15 minutes to wipe it off as instructed and it turned out beautiful.
reviews.author: Dreamweaver

reviews.title: "Uneven color through out the floor"

reviews.text: My contractor seemed happy overall with this grout, but the color is SO OFF from the color on the bag and the samples at Lowe's. Charcoal came out the color of concrete. We are now buying grout refresh and going through the tedious task of painting over the grout to make it coordinate with our tile - super bummed out.

reviews.title: "Not for beginners - inconsistent color - Frost"
reviews.text: Read all the poor reviews before you buy. You have a good chance of having all problems listed - we did. Following the directions will not help. Also - there are a lot of five star reviews for this product with no comment -highly suspicious. Mixed the exact amount of filtered water - ended up using a little more because it just fell out of the grout lines. After hours of hard work we noticed that the grout was drying almost white in places. You need perfect conditions that are not listed on the label to get the best results - the perfect amount of the right filtered water and the perfect application time and possibly a bag of grout that is not defective. If your grout color is important to you do NOT use this grout unless you like to gamble. Attempting now to darken lighter areas by rewetting and slowing drying time as stated in another review. I also noticed that 411 sealer slightly darkened the grout on a sample I made so I will use it after I've attempted to darken the light areas. We have two bathrooms to renovate and I will not be using Mapei. If I could go back in time, I would not do it differently - I would have bought a different grout.

questions.question: "do you need to seal this grout?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: wolfman
answers.text: No, i have done at least a dozen tile jobs in my life, and I have never sealed one of them, the jobs from a long time ago, look the same today as they did 10 years ago. If you have a very damp area like a closed in laundry room etc. It probably wouldnt be a bad idea

answers.author: Darrell
answers.text: All grout needs to be sealed.

answers.author: diygirl
answers.text: yes-if you want it to last.

answers.author: Troy
answers.text: Recommend you seal it espicaly if have pets use either sealer you apply after it dries or use grout boost

answers.author: floorpro
answers.text: If its installed on backsplash for shower

answers.author: Ginny
answers.text: We used grout boost for sealing at the time we grouted. Only finished a week ago, so don't really know how it works yet.

answers.author: Larry
answers.text: I did it though I was told I did not have to seal.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, it does require sealing. Mapei recommends sealing after 7 days for best results.

answers.author: Danny
answers.text: I would recommend sealing it to help with cleaning and seal it with a sealer that last 3-5 years. A buddy sealed his and lasted about 12 years with sealing it twice.

answers.author: Rick
answers.text: yes mainly in heavy traffic areas .

answers.author: Culbey
answers.text: In my opinion, all grout needs to be sealed. It's basically colored concrete and that means its porous and will soak up water/stains.

answers.author: KarlHungus
answers.text: Yes, absolutely seal it. You will be glad you did. Please beware of this grout, because it will come out lighter than the color is advertised. I just posted a bad review and I wish I had seen all of the other bad reviews of this brand. Just click on a review for another color, chances are there are many people that had the same problem I did. The grout will dry MUCH lighter than you are lead to believe. If you haven't installed it already, return it and buy a shade 2x darker. Better yet, buy a different product!

questions.question: "How many square feet does this product cover?"
questions.author: pebaile

answers.author: DJ
answers.text: according to the MAPEI Calculator a 6 x 36 x 3/8 tile for a 305 sqft room with a 5/32" joint will require 3-10# bags or 2-25# bags. Try the calculator http://www.mapei.com/US-EN/grout-calculator.asp

answers.author: Kevin
answers.text: It depends on tile size and the gap. Using 12 x 12 tiles and a gap of 1/4 inch will cover 190 sq foot per 25 lb bag. A 3/8 inch gap will cover 126 sq. foot per bag.

answers.author: ContractingTeam
answers.text: Roughly 10 square feet depending on how the tile spacing width.

answers.author: ContractingTeam
answers.text: You will need 2.67 pounds of grout per square foot if spacing is 3/8's which is standard. Other widths are as follows: 1/4" - 2.24 lbs, 1/2" - 2.90 lbs. A 25 pound bag for 3/8th's would cover 9.36 sqaure feet.

questions.question: "If mixed with water, does the Mapei Keracolor grout need to be sealed after it has cured?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Hoofy
answers.text: Sealing grout is always a good idea. In an area where there is exposure to water it's pretty much vital to do.

answers.author: DIYer867
answers.text: Yes, I used Mapei Keracolor grout on my kitchen floor and it does need to be sealed (possibly multiple times).

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, it needs to be sealed.

questions.question: "Does this kind of grout needs to be cure and seal? And with what?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Skeeter
answers.text: Wait a couple of day's for cure. I've never used a sealer, never ever had a problem. If you want to use a sealer, That's up to you. Thanks.

answers.author: Greg
answers.text: Yes it dies but it's easy with spray sealer

answers.author: Bosley522
answers.text: This grout does not need to be (nor should it be) sealed with a grout sealant.

questions.question: "Grout color drying much lighter than the brown-tan color."
questions.author: Kirklitz

answers.author: Sarah-Flooring
answers.text: It sounds to me like you are describing efforvescence. This happens when you have minerals in your water that react with the grout pigments or if you are using too much water when wiping the tiles clean. This makes the grout milky or white. There's nothing you can really do now that you've installed the grout, other than let it fade over the years, but it will never be really dark. My suggestion would be for grout that is already installed, use the pigmented sealer by Mapei called grout refresh in the Chamois coloway. This will seal the grout and make it a uniform color. In the future, use as little water as you can when installing, and use distilled water to mix the grout.

answers.author: Hgl39
answers.text: You might try a sealer (water based) on a test piece that has been grouted. Let each coat dry thoroughly before applying the next coat. Continue until you achieve the desired color in the grout.

answers.author: NCjsutton
answers.text: That is the color mine came out to be too wanted a darker brown my recommendation is to keep it wet as it drys with a spray bottle or get the darker brown color grouted.

questions.question: "Can this be used outdoors on a mosaic?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: MAPEI
answers.text: Thank you for your inquiry regarding MAPEI Products! Yes, you can use the Mapei Keracolor Sanded outdoors with your mosaic installation. Please note, it should be protected from water immersion or freezing for a minimum of 21 days. Thank you! Product Advisor #11

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, this can be used outdoors on a mosaic

questions.question: "is this a cement or non-cement grout? Whats the best way to remove dry haze?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: MAPEI
answers.text: Thank you for your inquiry regarding Mapei products! Yes, the Mapei Keracolor Sanded is a portland cement based grout. You can clean off the grout haze on the surface of your tiles using a cement grout haze remover as follows OR follow the directions on the packaging of the haze remover that you purchase.  Pre-wet the surface with water  Use full-strength, do not dilute  Let cleaner dwell on surface for at least 10 minutes (up to 15)  Scrub with a white nylon scrubpad (with firm pressure)  Wipe, mop, or vacuum up residual cleaner and grout residue after scrubbing  Rinse the area well with clean water Thank you! Product Advisor # 11

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: This is a non-cement grout.

questions.question: "How much water is needed to mix one 10lb. bag?"
questions.author: rob

answers.author: MAPEI
answers.text: Hello Rob: For a 10 lb. bag of Keracolor S, the amount of water needed is 26 Oz. If you need any further information, please do not hesitate to call us at 1-800-992-6273. Thank you very much for your interest in MAPEI products. -Product Advisor #7

questions.question: "What's the coverage area for this product?"
questions.author: JoDardo

answers.author: MAPEI
answers.text: Grout coverage will vary quite a bit depending on tile size, tile thickness, and grout joint width. Be sure to reference the handy coverage chart on the back of the bag, or feel free to give us a call at 1-800-992-6273 for help estimating. Thank you very much for your interest in MAPEI products. -Product Advisor #7

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: This product for grout joint widths from 1/8-in to 5/8-in.
